TITLE.value: Legal Services Accelerator - Case Management System Ecosystem Reference Model

Purpose.value: To provide a high-level, generalized architectural overview of a Case Management System (CMS) and its common integrations within a typical law firm, including key human actors and their primary interactions, serving as a blueprint for system design and evaluation.

Scope.value: Focuses on the primary systems and human actors interacting directly or indirectly with the CMS, and the key data flows between them. Does not detail internal system components or low-level technical integrations.

TargetAudience.value: Legal IT Leadership, Solution Architects, Business Stakeholders, System Integrators, Vendors, Training Teams

Disclaimer.value: This is a reference model and may require adaptation to specific firm requirements, existing systems, and regulatory environments.

systems.Description: Manages legal cases, workflows, tasks, and document tracking.
systems.Key Capabilities: Case intake; Timeline management; Task assignment; Legal calendaring; Workflow automation; Core matter data storage
systems.Commercial Examples: Clio, Thomson Reuters Legal Tracker, PracticePanther, Aderant, Elite 3E

systems.Description: Stores and manages legal documents, contracts, and templates.
systems.Key Capabilities: Version control; Access control; Document tagging; Search & retrieval; Email management; Secure sharing

systems.Description: Tracks billable hours, generates invoices, manages client accounts, and handles financial postings.
systems.Key Capabilities: Time capture; Expense tracking; Rate management; Invoicing; Trust accounting; General Ledger integration
systems.Commercial Examples: Timeslips, Bill4Time, Zola Suite, Aderant, Elite 3E, Sage Intacct

systems.Description: Manages client engagement, prospective client data, marketing activities, and communication history.
systems.Key Capabilities: Client intake; Contact tracking; Communication logs; Marketing automation; Lead management; Opportunity tracking
systems.Commercial Examples: Law Ruler, HubSpot, Salesforce (Legal templates), Intapp OnePlace

systems.Description: Curates and disseminates legal research, precedents, internal expertise, and legal memos.
systems.Key Capabilities: Research indexing; Precedent library; Expertise locator; Enterprise search; Internal publications
systems.Commercial Examples: LexisNexis, Westlaw Edge, Harvey AI, Luminance, Internal SharePoint/Teams portals

systems.Description: Manages legal staff, roles, availability, professional development, and leave.
systems.Key Capabilities: Recruitment; Onboarding; Training; Licensing tracking; Availability tracking; Performance management

systems.Description: Tracks physical and electronic case files and correspondence, ensuring compliance with retention policies.
systems.Key Capabilities: Retention policies; Archiving; Legal holds; Audit trails; Records classification; Disposition management
systems.Commercial Examples: OpenText, M-Files, Microsoft SharePoint (with Records Management features), HPE Content Manager

systems.Description: Ensures adherence to legal, ethical, and professional regulations, managing conflicts and compliance risks.
systems.Key Capabilities: Conflict checks; Compliance dashboards; Ethical walls; Sanctions screening; Audit logs; AML/KYC checks
systems.Commercial Examples: Intapp Conflicts, NAVEX Global, Thomson Reuters CLEAR, OneTrust

systems.Description: Provides secure, self-service access for clients to view case status, share documents, and communicate.
systems.Key Capabilities: Document sharing; Case status tracking; Secure messaging; Notifications; Online payments
systems.Commercial Examples: MyCase, Actionstep Client Portal, Clio Grow, Custom client portals

systems.Description: Generates legal documents using templates, structured data, and predefined logic.
systems.Key Capabilities: Template library; Data-driven generation; Clause management; Approval workflows; Digital signatures integration
systems.Commercial Examples: HotDocs, ContractExpress, Woodpecker, Litera Drafting, DocuSign Gen

systems.Description: Provides insights on case trends, litigation risks, operational efficiency, and financial performance.
systems.Key Capabilities: Outcome prediction; Workload analysis; Time-to-resolution metrics; Benchmarking; Financial reporting; Matter budgeting
systems.Commercial Examples: Premonition, Lex Machina, Everlaw, Power BI, Tableau, Aderant BI

systems.Description: Manages user identities, authentication, and authorization across all firm systems.
systems.Key Capabilities: Single Sign-On (SSO); Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA); User Provisioning/De-provisioning; Access Governance; Directory Services
systems.Commercial Examples: Azure Active Directory, Okta, Ping Identity, Microsoft Entra ID

systems.Description: Manages internal and external communications, including email, calendaring, and collaboration tools.
systems.Key Capabilities: Email; Calendaring; Instant Messaging; Video Conferencing; File Sharing; Archiving
systems.Commercial Examples: Microsoft 365 (Exchange, Teams), Google Workspace, Zoom, Cisco Webex

systems.Description: Legal professionals responsible for managing cases, advising clients, drafting documents, and recording time.
systems.Key Capabilities: Case Management; Document Drafting; Legal Research; Client Communication; Time Recording

systems.Description: Legal support staff assisting lawyers with case administration, document preparation, and research.
systems.Key Capabilities: Case Administration; Document Preparation; Research Assistance; Scheduling; Communication Support

systems.Description: Individuals or organizations seeking legal services from the firm.
systems.Key Capabilities: Case Inquiry; Document Review; Communication; Payment

systems.Description: Personnel responsible for financial operations, invoicing, and client accounting.
systems.Key Capabilities: Invoicing; Payment Processing; Trust Accounting; Financial Reporting

systems.Description: General administrative and support personnel for the firm's operations.
systems.Key Capabilities: Scheduling; Data Entry; Records Management; Office Support

interactions.Entities: Milestones, CalendarEvents, CaseDocuments (shared links), Notifications, InvoiceSummary
